headline: Zero active contributors → no PRs merged
detail: The team has no active contributors, resulting in zero PRs merged over the last week. This has led to a complete halt in development, with no code reviews or updates. The lack of contributors is the primary cause of the current stagnation.
recommendation: Recruit and onboard new contributors to resume development activities

headline: Cycle Time increase → slower delivery
detail: The time it takes for PRs to go from open to merge has more than doubled, with cycle times now taking nearly 40 hours. This increase in cycle time is affecting the team's ability to deliver changes quickly. Review times have also increased significantly, with the time to first review taking several hours longer than before.
recommendation: Investigate and address the causes of the increased review and cycle times to improve delivery speed

headline: AI-assisted PRs slowing cycle time → delivery slowing

This slowdown is contributing to the overall decrease in throughput, with 16.8% fewer PRs being merged. The team's review process is also being impacted, with coderabbitai having 40 pending reviews, significantly higher than the team average.
